145.title: Alternative Comic Books, Strips, Etc.
notes:
This is a kind of anti-genre genre. As used here the term is applied primarily to comics published in the 1990s and later and explicitly non-"mainstream," eschewing to various degrees formulaic stories, commercial production values and newsstand distribution. Some of these, at least in the United States, developed from the New Wave self-published minicomix movement and the largely amateur Black and White Explosion of the 1980s. Some continue the tradition of Underground Comix of the 1960s and 1970s, and some, in the spirit of the word "alternative," can only be called "other." A new generation of creators and publishers can be seen asserting itself at a professional or semi-professional level. The category is largely subjective, though a few titles are self-identified in titles or front matter. Some examples, not repeated in the list which follows this box, might be:
  • Acme Novelty Library
  • Action Girl Comics
  • Artbabe
  • Big Mouth
  • Bitterkomix
  • Buzzard
  • Collection Patte de Mouche
  • Doofus
  • Duplex Planet Illustrated
  • Jar of Fools
  • The Land of Nod
  • Liliane
  • Milk & Cheese
  • Optic Nerve
  • Original Strips (in the zine Comic Culture)
  • Peep Show
  • Pixy
  • Prime Cuts
  • Raw
  • Twisted Sisters
  • Viz Comic
  • Zero Zero
